code: // Observe every occurrence of CameraChanged event.

inlineContent.text: holds the resources allocated for the subscription and can be used to cancel it. If the cancelable
object is deallocated, the subscription will be cancelled immediately.
The simplified diagram of the events emitted by the map is displayed below.
MapboxMap should only be used from the main thread.

A convex polygon that describes the shape of the screen in case it is non-rectangular.
Every coordinate is in 0 to 1 range, with (0, 0) being the map view top-left and (1, 1) the bottom-right.
The points have to be given in clockwise winding order. The polygon will be closed automatically, so for a rectangular shape, pass in 4 points.
Use this if the visible screen area is obscured enough that using a custom shape improves performance.

The camera has changed. This event is emitted whenever the visible viewport
changes due to the MapView’s size changing or when the camera
is modified by calling camera methods. The event is emitted synchronously,
so that an updated camera state can be fetched immediately.
